segments.text: I see a woman so focused on polishing that plate, seemingly oblivious to the chaos unfolding around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascades over the sink, pooling on the floor like a tiny flood, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel surprised that she hasn't noticed the mess, as it grows beneath her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, untouched by the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: In stark contrast, the children are up to no good, with that boy climbing on an unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever realize that she’s standing in a puddle, completely unaware of the disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's something so innocent about the little girl, reaching up with her palm open, anticipating a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR
